Package org.fest.reflect

Provides a Fluent Interface for the Java Reflection API.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Constructor<T> Understands the use of reflection to access a constructor from an object.
Constructor.ParameterTypes  
Constructor.TargetType  
Field<T> Understands the use of reflection to access a field from an object.
Field.FieldName  
Field.FieldType<T>  
Method<T> Understands the use of reflection to access a method from an object.
Method.MethodName  
Method.ParameterTypes<T>  
Method.ReturnType<T>  
Reflection Understands the entry point for the classes in this package.
 

Exception Summary
ReflectionError Understands an error raised when using reflection.
 

Package org.fest.reflect Description

Provides a Fluent Interface for the Java Reflection API.

Here are some examples: 

   // import static org.fest.reflect.Reflection.*;

   Person person = constructor().withParameterTypes(String.class)
                                .in(Person.class)
                                .newInstance("Yoda");
   method("setName").withParameterTypes(String.class)
                    .in(person)
                    .invoke("Luke");
   field("name").ofType(String.class)
                .in(person)
                .set("Anakin");
